question: What are the two ways to buy items on eBay?
answer: You can buy items on eBay either with Buy It Now, where you pay a fixed price and buy the item immediately, or by bidding in an auction to try to win the item for a lower price.

question: How can I track my buying activity on eBay?
answer: You can keep track of all your buying activity in your Purchase history.

question: What should I do if an item I bought hasn't arrived?
answer: You can get help with an item that hasn't arrived by looking at the relevant articles provided on eBay.

question: How can I make an offer on an item?
answer: On some listings, sellers accept offers, and you can find guidance on how to make an offer and respond to counteroffers in the helpful articles on eBay.

question: What options do I have if I want to cancel my order?
answer: If you've bought an item and made a mistake, eBay can walk you through the process of canceling your order.

question: How many items can I add to my Watchlist?
answer: You can add up to 500 items to your Watchlist.

question: What happens if I stop receiving email alerts for my Watchlist?
answer: If you stop receiving email alerts about items you’re watching, you’ll still see notifications about your Watchlist in My eBay.

question: How can I remove an item from my Watchlist?
answer: To remove an item, simply tick the box beside each item and select Delete. You can select and delete multiple items at once.

question: Can other members buy items that are on my Watchlist?
answer: Yes, other members can still buy the items you're watching.

question: What should I do if an item on my Watchlist is ended by the seller?
answer: If an item added to your Watchlist is ended by the seller and not relisted after 60 days, it will be removed from your list to ensure that you are shown available and up to date listings.

question: How can I access my purchase history?
answer: You can access your purchase history by going to the designated section in your account, where you'll find all your orders from the past 7 years.

question: What can I do if I need to return an item?
answer: To return an item, go to your purchase history, select the More actions dropdown menu next to the purchase, and choose the option to return the item.

question: Can I delete items from my purchase history?
answer: You can’t permanently delete items from your purchase history, but you can hide items you've bought in the last 60 days.

question: How do I hide an item from my purchase history?
answer: To hide an item, select the More actions dropdown next to the item you’d like to hide and choose 'Hide order.' If you hide something by mistake, you can select 'Undo Hide.'

question: How can I find older purchases that are more than 60 days old?
answer: To find items you bought more than 60 days ago, go to 'See orders from' at the top of your purchase history and choose the year from the dropdown. Your purchases will automatically update to reflect the year selected.

question: How do I make a Best Offer on an item?
answer: To make a Best Offer, find an item with a Make Offer button, select it, enter your offer, and optionally add a message to the seller. Then select Continue, confirm your payment and shipping information, and select Send.

question: What happens if the seller accepts my Best Offer?
answer: If the seller accepts your offer, the item will remain available to other buyers until you complete payment for it. If you have enabled autopay, eBay will collect payment from you as soon as the seller accepts your offer, securing the item instantly.

question: Can I retract a Best Offer after I've submitted it?
answer: You can retract a Best Offer if there are 12 hours or more left before the listing ends, and if you placed your most recent offer less than an hour ago. However, you cannot retract your offer if the listing ends in less than 12 hours and it's been more than an hour since your last offer, or if the seller has already accepted, declined, or sent you a counteroffer.

question: How can I find listings that accept Best Offers?
answer: To find listings that accept Best Offers, you can filter your search results by selecting 'Accepts offers' at the top of the search results. Alternatively, you can use the Advanced search option, enter your keywords, scroll down to Buying format, and select Best Offer before selecting Search.

question: What should I consider when making a Best Offer?
answer: When making a Best Offer, be reasonable with your offer, consider adding a friendly message to the seller, check the item's original listing date to gauge flexibility, and remember that there is a limit on the number of Best Offers you can make on each item.

question: How can I find my recently viewed items on eBay?
answer: You can find your recently viewed items by going to My eBay in the top right-hand corner and selecting Recently viewed, selecting Your Recently Viewed Items on the homepage, or looking under Your Recently Viewed Items on the left-hand side of the search results page.

question: Do I need to be signed in to see my recently viewed items?
answer: Yes, you'll need to sign in to your account to see your recently viewed items. If you weren’t signed in when you were browsing eBay, the listings you viewed won’t appear.

question: Can I delete individual items from my recently viewed items?
answer: No, you won’t be able to delete individual items from your recently viewed items, but you can clear all items you've viewed.

question: What should I do if I can't find a listing I was interested in?
answer: If you can’t find the listing of an item you were interested in, you can look at the article about finding a listing.

question: What is a tip for keeping track of items I'm considering buying?
answer: If you’re thinking about buying an item, you can add it to your Watchlist so it’s easier to find.

question: How can I track my item after purchasing it on eBay?
answer: Learn how to track your item all the way to your doorstep.

question: What should I do if my item hasn't arrived by the estimated delivery date?
answer: Find out what to do if your item hasn’t arrived by the estimated delivery date.

question: Is there a way to save money on shipping when buying multiple items?
answer: Save money by combining shipping when you buy more than one item from the same seller.

question: Where can I find the shipping charges and estimated delivery date for an item?
answer: You'll find the delivery details for an item, such as shipping charges and the estimated delivery date, in the Shipping and payments section of the listing.

question: What are the options for picking up items locally on eBay?
answer: Discover how to find, collect and pay for items that are available to pick up in your local area.

question: How can I add an item to my shopping cart?
answer: To add an item to your shopping cart, select Add to cart beneath the Buy It Now button on any fixed-price listing.

question: What happens if I add items to my cart but don't buy them?
answer: You’re under no obligation to buy items you’ve added to your shopping cart, but items in your cart can still be bought by other members until you’ve completed checkout.

question: Can I pay for items in my cart from different sellers at once?
answer: Generally, you can pay for all of the items in your cart together, even if they're from different sellers, by selecting Go to checkout.

question: How do I remove an item from my cart?
answer: If you're no longer interested in an item in your cart, select Remove next to the item. You can also choose to Save for later if you want to keep track of it.

question: Why might an item disappear from my cart?
answer: An item could be automatically removed from your cart for several reasons, such as someone else purchasing the item, the seller or eBay ending the listing early, or if the item was listed in an auction-style format with a Buy It Now option and someone else placed a bid.

question: What is advanced search used for?
answer: Advanced search is used to apply filters like price range, item condition, or listing format to narrow down search results.

question: How do I access advanced search on eBay?
answer: You can access advanced search by selecting 'Advanced' next to the search bar.

question: What options can I choose from in advanced search?
answer: In advanced search, you can choose from Items, Stores, or eBay Motors.

question: When should I use advanced search?
answer: You should use advanced search when you want to make a last-minute offer on listings ending soon, find a listing using the item number, look for items near your address, or check out listings from your favorite sellers.

question: Can I refine my search after using advanced search?
answer: Yes, you can refine your search further by selecting extra filters on the search results page.

question: How can I save a search on eBay?
answer: After you search for an item, select Save this search at the top of the search results page.

question: What happens when I edit a saved search?
answer: When you edit an existing search, a new saved search will be created with the filters you've selected.

question: How do I receive email alerts for my saved searches?
answer: By default, you’ll receive email alerts to your registered email address whenever new items match your search or if there are updates to your saved search.

question: What steps do I take to unsubscribe from saved search emails?
answer: Go to Saved searches, select the envelope icon on the search you'd like to stop receiving emails about.

question: How can I remove a saved seller from My eBay?
answer: Go to Saved Sellers in My eBay and select the blue heart to the right of the seller you’d like to remove.

question: What are the benefits of choosing local pickup when buying items?
answer: You can collect the item in person, inspect it before you take it home, and save money by not having to pay for shipping.

question: How do I arrange a local pickup after making a purchase?
answer: Contact the seller to arrange a time and place to collect your item, and agree on how you’ll pay for it.

question: What payment methods can I use for local pickup items?
answer: In addition to credit card, Apple Pay, Google Pay, or PayPal, you can sometimes pay by internet banking, check, or money order—either beforehand or when you pick up your item. Sellers may also accept cash.

question: How will I receive the Local Pickup code after my purchase?
answer: After you’ve completed your purchase, we’ll send an email with a Local Pickup code (a QR code and a 6 digit code) to your Messages.

question: How can I find listings that offer local pickup on eBay?
answer: Select Free local pickup on the left-hand side of the search results page or use Advanced search to filter for local pickup listings.

question: What options do buyers have for processing payment when bidding on items eligible for combined shipping?
answer: Starting October 2024, buyers can choose 'Shop and ship separately' to have their payment process automatically 1 hour after winning an auction, or 'Shop more, ship together' to delay payment up to 7 days.

question: How can I track my bidding activity on eBay?
answer: You can track your bidding from the Bids/Offers section of My eBay.

question: What happens if I win an auction and have provided a payment method?
answer: If you win the auction and have provided a payment method, payment will be taken automatically to ensure smoother transactions for buyers and sellers.

question: What is shill bidding and is it allowed on eBay?
answer: Shill bidding is when a member who knows the seller bids on an item to drive up the price, and it is not allowed on eBay.

question: What should I do if I want to bid on an item but cannot due to the seller's restrictions?
answer: If you see a message asking you to contact the seller when trying to place a bid, let them know you'd like to bid, and they may change their requirements to allow you to participate.

question: Where can I find the expected delivery date for an item I want to buy on eBay?
answer: You can find an expected delivery date on any eBay listing that offers shipping, usually in an estimated date range.

question: How are expected delivery dates calculated on eBay?
answer: Expected delivery dates are calculated based on handling time, shipping or courier services, item location, shipping address, and cleared payment.

question: What should I do if I need my item to arrive by a specific date?
answer: Check the expected delivery dates on the listing before you go to checkout to ensure it will arrive on time.

question: Does free shipping affect the expected delivery date?
answer: Yes, if you see a free shipping message in a listing, you can expect to receive your item within 4 business days without any delivery charge.

question: Can items be delivered on weekends?
answer: Whether an item can be delivered during the weekend depends on the shipping options provided by the seller, as expected delivery dates are based on working days.

question: How can I find out the shipping costs for an item on eBay?
answer: You can find the shipping cost in the shipping section of every eBay listing. It is shown separately from the item cost.

question: What should I do if I want to see the seller's shipping options?
answer: You can see the seller's shipping options, including express shipping services and combined shipping discounts, by selecting 'See details' next to the shipping cost at the top of the listing or by selecting the 'Shipping and payments' tab.

question: Can I save on shipping costs when buying multiple items from the same seller?
answer: Yes, if the seller offers combined shipping, you may be able to save on the shipping costs when buying multiple items.

question: What happens if a seller wants to increase shipping rates after I've made a purchase?
answer: Once you've bought an item, the seller can't increase shipping rates without asking your permission. If you don't agree with the change, you can contact eBay for assistance.

question: Is there a way to filter search results for items that have free shipping?
answer: Yes, when searching for an item, you can select the 'Free shipping' filter on the left-hand side of the search results page to see listings that don’t charge for delivery.

question: How can I cancel an order I placed?
answer: To cancel an order, go to your Purchase history, find the order you want to cancel, select the More actions dropdown menu, and then select Cancel this order. Finally, select Submit.

question: What happens if the seller has already shipped my order?
answer: If the seller has already shipped your order, you won't be able to cancel it and will need to wait until you receive the item to request a return.

question: Can I cancel individual items in an order that contains multiple items?
answer: No, if your purchase contains more than one item, the entire order will need to be canceled; you can't cancel individual items.

question: What should I do if my cancellation request is declined?
answer: If your cancellation request is declined, or if the item has already been shipped, you'll need to wait until you receive the item and then request a return.

question: How long does the seller have to respond to my cancellation request?
answer: The seller has 3 calendar days to accept or decline your cancellation request.

question: Can I retract my bid on any item?
answer: No, you can't always retract a bid once it's made. For example, bids on items listed in Trading Cards categories can't be retracted.

question: What should I do if I accidentally bid the wrong amount?
answer: You can retract your bid if you accidentally bid the wrong amount. After retracting the incorrect bid, enter the price you intended to bid.

question: What circumstances allow me to retract my bid?
answer: You can retract your bid if the seller significantly changed the description of the item or if you accidentally bid the wrong amount, but this is only applicable within 1 hour after making the bid when the listing is ending in less than 12 hours.

question: What if I can't retract my bid?
answer: If you're not able to retract your bid, you can try contacting the seller to see if they'll cancel your bid for you, but the seller is not obligated to agree to cancel it.

question: Is there a tip for avoiding mistakes when bidding?
answer: Yes, when bidding, always double-check that you've entered the correct amount, especially when making a last minute bid.

question: What is automatic bidding on eBay?
answer: Automatic bidding is the easiest way to bid on an eBay auction. You simply enter the highest price you’re willing to pay for an item, and eBay will bid on your behalf.

question: How do I set up automatic bidding?
answer: To set up automatic bidding on an auction listing, enter the maximum amount you’d like to pay for the item and select Place bid. eBay will bid in increments on your behalf up to your limit.

question: What happens if I am outbid immediately after placing a bid?
answer: If you are outbid immediately after placing a bid, it’s likely that another bidder is using automatic bidding and has a maximum limit higher than yours. You’ll need to increase your maximum limit to be the highest bidder.

question: What are bid increments?
answer: Bid increments are the amounts by which your bid increases when someone else places a bid. They are smaller when the bid price is low and larger in higher price brackets.

question: What should I consider when deciding my maximum bid amount?
answer: When deciding your maximum bid, be sure you’re happy to pay that amount if you win the auction, and remember to account for the cost of shipping as well.

question: What is a Second Chance Offer?
answer: A Second Chance Offer is when a seller offers you the item you were bidding on, even though you weren’t the winner. This could be because they found more stock, or their reserve price wasn’t met, but they still want to sell the item.

question: How can I accept a Second Chance Offer?
answer: If you’d like to accept the offer, select Buy it in the email and complete payment like any other eBay purchase. You can also view and accept a Second Chance Offer in the Bids/Offers section of My eBay.

question: How long do I have to accept a Second Chance Offer?
answer: You’ll have either 1, 3, 5, or 7 days to accept the offer, depending on how long the seller has chosen.

question: How can I confirm that a Second Chance Offer is legitimate?
answer: You’ll always find legitimate Second Chance Offers in your Messages and in the Bids/Offers section of My eBay. We’ll never send a Second Chance Offer email with the subject line 'Message from eBay Member.'

question: Can I opt out of receiving Second Chance Offers?
answer: Yes, you can opt out of receiving Second Chance Offers by changing your communications preferences in My eBay.

question: What should I do if I receive a counteroffer from a seller?
answer: You can accept, reject, or continue negotiating by making another offer to the seller.

question: How can I accept a counteroffer?
answer: Select 'Buy it' in the counteroffer message to accept and commit to buy.

question: What happens if I don't respond to a counteroffer?
answer: If you don’t respond to the seller’s counteroffer, it’ll expire after 24 hours, or when the listing ends—whichever comes first.

question: Is there a limit to how many offers I can make?
answer: You can make a total of 5 offers on most items or 10 in most vehicle categories.

question: What should I keep in mind if I accept a counteroffer?
answer: If you accept a counteroffer, you’re committing to buy the item and you’ll need to complete payment like any other eBay purchase.

question: Can I end a fixed price listing at any time?
answer: Yes, you can end an eBay fixed price listing at any time.

question: How do I end a listing in Seller Hub?
answer: To end a listing in Seller Hub, go to the Active listings page, select the checkbox next to the item you want to end, and from the dropdown menu, select End item.

question: What are some valid reasons to end a listing early?
answer: Valid reasons to end a listing early include if the item is lost, broken, or no longer available, or if you made a mistake in your listing, such as listing the wrong starting price in an auction.

question: What happens if I try to end an auction listing with bids?
answer: If your auction listing has bids, you can only end it one at a time by selecting a valid reason, and you may be charged a final value fee based on the highest bid.

question: Is it possible to revise my listing instead of ending it?
answer: Yes, if you made a mistake in your listing, you may be able to revise your listing or change your item price instead of ending it early.

question: How can I find the cost of international shipping on eBay?
answer: You'll find the estimated cost of shipping in the Shipping and payments section of every eBay listing.

question: What should I do if I have questions about shipping from an international seller?
answer: Contact the seller before you go to checkout if you have any questions about shipping.

question: What are the options for paying import charges when using eBay International Shipping?
answer: You can choose to pay import charges at checkout or defer them until delivery.

question: What is the Global Shipping Programme and how does it benefit buyers?
answer: The Global Shipping Programme allows buyers to pay all shipping, taxes, and import charges up front, and it includes customs clearance, so buyers don’t need to handle extra paperwork.

question: What responsibilities do I have regarding customs and import charges when purchasing internationally?
answer: As a buyer, it's your responsibility to check which customs and import charges may apply and to pay them.

question: How can I save on shipping when buying multiple items on eBay?
answer: You can save on shipping by asking sellers to combine shipping, as they may ship everything to you in the same package, potentially offering a shipping discount.

question: What should I do if I want to combine shipping after I've already paid for items?
answer: If you’ve already paid for a number of items that haven’t been marked as shipped, you can ask the seller if they are able to combine shipping.

question: What new option will buyers see starting October 2024 regarding combined shipping?
answer: Starting October 2024, some buyers will see a Timing option when placing a bid on eligible items, allowing them to choose between Shop and ship separately or Shop more, ship together.

question: How do I know if a seller offers combined shipping?
answer: Many sellers automatically combine shipping if you’re buying multiple items, and you can see the combined shipping total at checkout after adding items to your cart.

question: What should I do if the shipping costs for additional items are not specified?
answer: If the shipping section of the listing doesn’t specify costs for additional items, you’ll need to ask the seller before you pay.

question: What should I include in my item description when creating a listing?
answer: You should include your item's key selling points, exactly what you're including in the sale, and ensure full sentences with correct spelling and punctuation throughout.

question: What options do I have for describing the condition of my item?
answer: Your options for describing your item's condition vary by category and include options like New, Used, Seller refurbished, Certified - Refurbished, and more.

question: How can I add item specifics to my active listings?
answer: You can use the Seller Hub Download/Upload file tool to quickly update them in bulk by downloading an Excel copy of your active listings, updating the necessary fields, and then uploading the file again.

question: What are product identifiers and why are they important?
answer: Product identifiers are unique codes like brand name, GTIN, UPC, or ISBN that can be used to identify a specific product. They are important because most new and refurbished branded items have these identifiers on their packaging.

question: What tools does eBay offer for creating listings?
answer: eBay offers several tools including a quick listing tool for casual sellers, an advanced listing tool for all Seller Hub users, and a Scan to list tool specifically for trading cards.

question: What happens if my eBay item doesn't sell?
answer: If an item you list on eBay doesn’t sell, we can automatically relist it for you to get it back in front of buyers.

question: How many times can my auction-style listing be automatically relisted?
answer: Auctions with a duration of 5 days or more will be automatically relisted up to 8 times, and auctions with a duration of 1 or 3 days will be automatically relisted up to 8 times as a 7-day listing.

question: Are there any fees for automatic relisting?
answer: Auto-relists are free, except for listings in vehicles categories.

question: Can I manually relist an item, and if so, how?
answer: Yes, you can manually relist your item. In My eBay, find your item in the Unsold section and select Relist under actions, or in Seller Hub, check the box beside the listing on the Manage unsold listings page and select Relist.

question: What should I do if I don't want my item to be relisted after a refund?
answer: If you don’t want your item to be relisted after issuing a refund, simply uncheck the Relist item or Relist item after cancellation box when issuing the refund.

question: How many pictures can I add to my eBay listing?
answer: You can add up to 24 pictures to your eBay listing.

question: What is the maximum file size for each photo I upload?
answer: The maximum file size for each photo you upload is 7MB.

question: How can I replace a photo that I copied from a web address?
answer: To replace a photo copied from a web address, use a new URL for the replacement photo.

question: What should I do if I'm having trouble adding photos?
answer: If you're having trouble adding photos, make sure you're using an accepted file format, check the file size, clear your browser's cache, and disable any pop-up blocking software.

question: What is the purpose of the gallery photo in my listing?
answer: The gallery photo is the first picture you add, which appears next to your item’s title in search results and is the main photo in your listing.

question: How can I track my package after the seller ships it?
answer: Once the seller ships your item, you can keep track of its progress on its way to you.

question: What should I do if I don't see a tracking number for my order?
answer: If you can't see a tracking number, the seller may need to upload the tracking information. You can contact the seller to ask them to add tracking.

question: Can I track an order if I purchased it as a guest?
answer: Yes, to track items you bought as a guest, you’ll need the order confirmation email we sent to the email address you entered at checkout.

question: What information will I see if my seller is using a tracked shipping service?
answer: If your seller is using a tracked shipping service, you’ll be able to view carrier information as well as your order’s current location.

question: Where can I find my eBay guest order confirmation email?
answer: Find your eBay guest order confirmation email; the subject line starts with 'Order Confirmed'.

question: What should I do if I need to change my shipping address after making a purchase?
answer: Contact the seller as soon as possible to let them know. If the item hasn't been sent yet, you can ask the seller to cancel the transaction and then repurchase the item with the correct shipping address.

question: Can a seller change the shipping address after I've completed my purchase?
answer: Sellers generally can’t change the shipping address that you provided at checkout.

question: What happens if I ask the seller to cancel my order?
answer: Once you've asked a seller to cancel the order, they can either accept or decline your request within 3 calendar days. If they accept, you'll receive a confirmation of the cancellation. If they decline or have already shipped your order, the package will be sent to the address you originally selected.

question: How can I change my shipping method after purchasing an item?
answer: If the seller hasn’t sent your package yet, you can ask them if it’s possible to change the shipping method. If they agree, you may need to pay extra for an express or tracked option.

question: What should I do if I realize my shipping address is incorrect at checkout?
answer: If it’s incorrect, or if you want to send the item to a different address, select Change in the Ship to field at checkout. You can then edit the address, select a different address, or add a new address.

question: How can I block a specific buyer on eBay?
answer: To block a specific buyer, go to the Block bidders or buyers from your listings page, enter the buyer's username in the text box, and select Submit.

question: Is there a limit to how many buyers I can block?
answer: Yes, you can add up to 5,000 usernames to your blocked buyers list.

question: What should I do if I want to unblock a buyer?
answer: To unblock a buyer, go to the Block bidders or buyers from your listings page, delete the username of the member from the text box, and select Submit.

question: Can I set buyer requirements based on specific criteria?
answer: Yes, you can block buyers based on criteria such as their location or if they have excessive canceled orders.

question: How can I restore a past blocked bidder list?
answer: You can restore a past blocked bidder/buyer list by selecting Restore list on the Block bidders or buyers from your listings page.

question: How can I contact a buyer who has purchased an item from me?
answer: Once someone's bought an item from you, you can contact them directly by selecting the appropriate button on eBay, which will guide you through the steps.

question: What should I do if I need to contact a bidder before they win my auction?
answer: If you need to get in touch with a bidder while an auction is still ongoing, you cannot obtain their contact details, but you can send them a message through eBay.

question: How is my response time to potential buyers calculated?
answer: Your response time is calculated based on data over the last 12 months. To be included, you must have received at least 1 question and answered over 60% of questions. Only the first question and response from each conversation are included in the calculation.

question: Can I share my phone number with buyers on eBay?
answer: Yes, you can share your phone number with buyers, but you need to opt in first by going to Account and selecting Manage communications with buyers, then choosing to share your phone number.

question: What is a Buyer Alias Email Address and how can I use it?
answer: The Buyer Alias Email Address is a unique email alias that ends in @members.ebay.com, which you can use to contact the buyer through email. This alias can be found in the View order details page.

question: How can I determine the right price for my items on eBay?
answer: You can look for similar products on eBay to see what other sellers are charging, and use eBay's search function to find similar listings and decide on a price.

question: What should I do if I'm unsure of my item's value?
answer: You can use eBay's search function to find similar listings and check completed listings to see how much items like yours have sold for in the past.

question: What is a reserve price in an auction-style listing?
answer: A reserve price is the lowest price you're willing to accept for the item, which can protect you from selling for less than you're comfortable with.

question: What is the minimum difference between the Buy It Now price and the starting price in an auction-style listing?
answer: The Buy It Now price must be at least 30% higher than the starting price.

question: Can I accept offers on my fixed price listing?
answer: Yes, you can choose to accept Best Offers, which allows a buyer to make an offer for your item that you can decide whether to accept.

question: What is the first step in getting my item in front of buyers?
answer: Creating a listing is the first step in getting your item in front of buyers.

question: How do Buy It Now listings work on eBay?
answer: With Buy It Now listings, you set a fixed price so buyers can purchase your item immediately.

question: What should I know about selling limits on eBay?
answer: eBay adjusts selling limits based on both your sales volume and feedback. You can learn where to find your selling limit and how to request a limit increase.

question: Can I make changes to my live listings?
answer: Yes, you can learn what changes you can make to your live listings and when you can make them.

question: How can I create and edit listings on the go?
answer: You can learn how to use eBay’s mobile app to create and edit listings on the go.

question: How do I add a category to my eBay listing?
answer: When you start listing your item, a category is usually pre-populated with suggestions based on your title. If you disagree with the suggestions, you can select Search categories or Browse categories to find an alternative.

question: Can I list my item in two categories?
answer: Yes, to add a second category, select Add a second category in the Product details section of the listing form. However, you will pay an insertion fee for including a second category.

question: Are there any categories where I cannot list in a second category?
answer: Yes, certain categories such as Heavy Equipment, DVD & Blu-ray Discs, Consumer Electronics (specific subcategories), Motor Vehicles, and Real Estate do not allow listings in a second category.

question: What happens if I choose a category that doesn't match my item?
answer: Sometimes eBay will change the category if your selection doesn’t match the item listed.

question: What should I do if my item has variations?
answer: When creating a listing with variations, you might want to consider listing in only one category, as not all categories allow for variations in a second category.

question: How can I add the Best Offer option to my eBay listing?
answer: You can add Best Offer to a listing by using the quick listing form or the advanced listing tool. For the quick listing form, list your item in fixed price format, select 'Change listing preferences', check 'Enable more options', then select 'More options' under Pricing and check 'Allow offers'. For the advanced listing tool, go to the Pricing section, set 'Allow offers' to on, and add a Minimum offer amount and/or an Auto accept amount.

question: What happens to current offers if I receive a bid on my auction-style listing with Best Offer?
answer: If you receive a bid on your auction-style listing with the Best Offer option, all current offers and counteroffers will be declined automatically, and buyers won't be able to make any additional offers on your item. If a bidder retracts their bid, the Best Offer feature will be re-enabled.

question: How do I respond to a Best Offer I received from a buyer?
answer: After receiving a Best Offer, you have 24 hours to respond. You can accept the Best Offer and end the listing, respond with a counteroffer, let the offer expire, or decline the offer.

question: Can I send offers to buyers who are interested in my items?
answer: Yes, if a buyer shows interest in your item (such as watching it or adding it to their cart), you can send them special offers. The item will remain available for purchase until the buyer successfully completes payment.

question: What should I do if I want to make a counteroffer to a buyer?
answer: When making a counteroffer, your response should be lower than the Buy It Now price but higher than the offer you received. You can respond directly to the potential buyer from the message you received about their Best Offer.

question: What are selling limits and why are they important?
answer: Selling limits are designed to help you grow your business in a manageable way and to ensure you can give your buyers great service.

question: How can I check my current selling limit?
answer: You can find your selling limit in Seller Hub by going to the Overview tab and scrolling down to the Monthly limits section.

question: What happens if I exceed my selling limit?
answer: If you exceed your selling limit, we may end any listings that you have created over your existing limit, but you can list them again when your monthly allowance renews or if you receive an increase in the amount that you can sell.

question: How can I request an increase in my selling limit?
answer: You can request a limit increase directly from the message we send you when you get close to your monthly limit, or by using the button in the Monthly selling limits section of My eBay's Selling Overview.

question: Are there limits for specific categories when I start selling?
answer: Yes, if you're new to selling in a particular category, we might limit how much you can sell to help you manage your inventory and understand any rules that may apply.

question: How can I find the items I've sold on eBay?
answer: You can find a history of the items you’ve sold in My eBay or Seller Hub.

question: Where do I look for my sold items in Seller Hub?
answer: In Seller Hub, look at your Orders tab to find your sold items.

question: What is the order number I receive after a sale?
answer: The order number is a 12-digit number you receive every time you complete a sale, which allows you to reference the entire order.

question: Can I search for sold items by order status?
answer: Yes, you can search by order status such as awaiting payment, awaiting postage, paid and posted, and awaiting feedback.

question: How far back can I view my sold items?
answer: You can view your sold items for up to the last 2 years.

question: How can I create a listing using the eBay app?
answer: To create a listing in the app, go to the Selling page and select List an item. You can scan your item’s barcode to automatically add product details, snap photos, and add them directly to your listing.

question: What should I do if I can't launch the eBay app?
answer: Check for updates in the app store and download the latest version. If you already have the latest version but can’t launch it, try uninstalling the app and then reinstalling it.

question: How do I enable notifications for the eBay app on my iOS device?
answer: Go to Settings and select eBay in Notifications. In Allow notifications, choose On. Then open the eBay app, go to Settings in My eBay, and choose which notifications you’d like to receive.

question: Is the eBay app available for both Android and iOS devices?
answer: Yes, the eBay app is available for both Android and iOS devices.

question: What should I do if photos won't upload in the eBay app?
answer: Try rebooting your mobile device. If that doesn’t solve the issue, uninstall and then reinstall the app.

question: How can I contact a seller after I've purchased an item?
answer: If you've already bought an item from a seller, you can contact them using the button provided or through your Purchase history by selecting 'Contact seller' next to the item.

question: What should I do if I want to ask a seller a question before buying an item?
answer: If the seller accepts questions, you can find the 'Contact seller' option in the Seller Information section of the listing. You can then choose the topic that best matches your question and send your message.

question: Where can I find a seller's phone number on eBay?
answer: You can find a seller's phone number if they've opted to share it by selecting 'Contact seller' and then 'Other' on the Find answers page, or by continuing to the contact form where the number will be displayed at the bottom of the page.

question: What should I do if a seller asks me to complete a purchase outside of eBay?
answer: If a seller asks you to complete a transaction outside of eBay, you should report it, as this poses a risk of fraud and is against eBay's policies.

question: Is there a way to receive a copy of my message when contacting a seller?
answer: Yes, when you type your question for the seller, you can select 'Send a copy to my email address' if you'd like to receive a copy of the message.

question: How can I leave feedback for a seller on eBay?
answer: You can leave feedback for a seller through your purchase history or after you receive an email reminder from eBay following your purchase.

question: What types of feedback can I leave for a seller?
answer: You can leave positive, neutral, or negative feedback, and you can also add comments about your experience.

question: What happens if I leave negative feedback for a seller?
answer: Negative feedback becomes a permanent part of a seller's record and can harm their reputation and business, so it's recommended to try to resolve any issues with the seller before leaving negative feedback.

question: How long do I have to leave feedback after a purchase?
answer: You can leave feedback for up to 60 days from the date you received your item or from the expected delivery date, whichever comes first. If no expected delivery date is provided, you have up to 90 days from when you completed your purchase.

question: What is automated feedback on eBay?
answer: Automated feedback is positive feedback that is automatically added to successfully completed transactions if you don't leave feedback within 7 days of the estimated delivery date, don't report an issue, and the seller has received 10 feedback or less.

question: What should I do if I have a problem with my order?
answer: Contact the seller first and try to resolve the issue before you leave feedback.

question: Why might a seller dispute my feedback?
answer: A seller may dispute your feedback if the issue that led to your feedback was beyond their control, they’ve resolved your issue and would like you to revise your feedback, or they feel you’ve been unfair or overlooked some information.

question: What happens if I receive a feedback revision request from a seller?
answer: If a seller sends a feedback revision request, you’ll receive an email with the details and have 10 days to either revise the feedback or decline the request.

question: How can I revise my feedback after accepting a seller's request?
answer: Select Accept request in the email, and we’ll guide you through the process of changing your rating and comment. When you revise or remove feedback, your original comments will no longer be visible.

question: What if I don’t respond to a feedback revision request?
answer: If you haven’t taken any action after 7 days, we’ll send you a reminder. If you don’t respond within 10 days, the revision request will expire and the feedback won’t be changed.

question: What are buying limits on eBay?
answer: Buying limits are account blocks that limit your ability to purchase items on the site. They can be placed by sellers and by eBay.

question: How can sellers restrict buyers from bidding on their listings?
answer: Sellers can block buyers with low feedback scores or buyers they no longer wish to do business with, making their listings unavailable to a specific list of bidders.

question: What causes eBay to place buying limits on my account?
answer: Buying limits may be placed if you are bidding on an expensive item, need to verify your identity, need to add a payment method to your account, have a history of canceled orders for not paying on time, have suddenly increased your bidding activity, or have several items awaiting payment.

question: What should I do if I receive a buying restriction on my account?
answer: If you receive a buying restriction, you'll get an email and a message in My eBay explaining why it was applied and what you need to do to have it removed.

question: How can I avoid buying limits and restrictions on eBay?
answer: To avoid buying limits and restrictions, you can only bid on or buy items you plan to pay for, pay for items as soon as possible, improve your feedback profile by leaving feedback for sellers, add a payment method to your account, and establish a buying history by purchasing items that require immediate payment.

question: How can I create a multi-quantity listing on eBay?
answer: To create a multi-quantity listing, select the Fixed price format and specify the number of items you have for sale in Quantity when creating your listing.

question: What should I do if I want to add variations to my eBay listing?
answer: To add variations, describe the features that are standard across all items, specify your variations and options for each variation, and ensure you review the inventory to match the quantities selected.

question: Can I update the quantity of items in my listing after it has been created?
answer: Yes, you can change how many items are available on your listing at any time by finding the listing in My eBay or Seller Hub, selecting Edit, and updating the quantity.

question: What is the out-of-stock option and how do I enable it?
answer: The out-of-stock option allows your listing to remain active but hidden from search results when you run out of stock. To enable it, go to Selling preferences, scroll down to Multi-quantity listings, and select the toggle beside Listings stay active when you're out of stock.

question: What happens if my Good 'Til Canceled listing has a quantity of 0 for 180 consecutive days?
answer: If your listing has a quantity of 0 for 180 consecutive days, eBay will end the listing.

question: Can I sell my eBay account?
answer: No, you cannot sell your eBay account or change its ownership.

question: What happens if I try to sell my eBay account?
answer: Attempting to sell an eBay account may result in buying and selling restrictions as well as account suspension or removal.

question: Why is it not allowed to transfer or sell an eBay account?
answer: Accounts cannot be transferred or sold because feedback is intended to reflect a seller’s performance, and the account has value when developed through a strong feedback rating and satisfied customers.

question: What should I do if someone offers to buy my eBay account?
answer: If someone offers to buy your eBay account, report it to eBay as soon as possible.

question: What is the importance of feedback on my eBay account?
answer: Feedback reflects a seller’s performance and contributes to the value of your eBay account.

question: What should I do if I have an issue with a buyer?
answer: The best first step is to get in touch with them directly and try to work things out.

question: How can I contact a buyer on eBay?
answer: You can contact your buyer by scrolling to the bottom of the help page and selecting 'Contact the buyer.'

question: Is there a way to block a buyer from bidding on my items?
answer: Yes, you can learn how to block certain members from bidding on or buying your items.

question: What should I do if I believe a buyer is violating eBay's policies?
answer: If you’re having trouble with a buyer and believe they’re violating an eBay policy, let eBay know about it.

question: Where can I find guides on dealing with buyer issues?
answer: You can read the guides provided on the help page to learn how to contact a buyer, block a buyer, and report issues.

question: Under what circumstances can I cancel a bid on my auction listing?
answer: You can cancel a bid when a buyer requests you to cancel their bid and you agree, you have to end the listing early because the item is no longer available for sale, you made an error in the listing, or you're concerned the bid may be from a fraudulent buyer.

question: What steps do I need to follow to cancel a bid?
answer: To cancel a bid, go to 'Canceling bids placed on your listing', enter the item number, the username of the member whose bid you’re canceling, and the reason for canceling the bid, then select Submit.

question: What happens to a bid once it is canceled?
answer: Once a bid is canceled, it cannot be reinstated.

question: How can I manage who bids on my items?
answer: You can set up buyer requirements to control where you’ll send items to and whether to accept bids from buyers with poor feedback scores. You can also add a buyer to your blocked buyer list if they have a history of not paying or have been aggressive or threatening.

question: What is the difference between canceling a bid and retracting a bid?
answer: When sellers remove a bid, it is called canceling a bid. When buyers remove a bid, it is called retracting a bid.

question: How can I follow up on feedback I've left for a seller?
answer: You can follow up by going to Feedback left for others, selecting Follow up next to the item number, writing your follow-up comment, and then selecting Leave Follow-up Comment.

question: Can I edit or delete feedback I've already left for a seller?
answer: Once you've left feedback, you cannot edit or delete it unless you ask the seller to send you a feedback revision request.

question: What happens if I submit positive feedback for a seller?
answer: Once you’ve submitted positive feedback for a seller, you can’t change it to neutral or negative feedback.

question: What should I do if I want to revise my original feedback?
answer: You can contact the seller directly and ask them to send you a feedback revision request. Once you receive the request, you’ll have 10 days to either revise or decline the request.

question: What happens if I don't respond to a feedback revision request?
answer: If you don’t respond to the revision request within 10 days, the feedback won’t be changed, and we’ll send you a reminder if you haven't responded after 7 days.

question: How can I check a seller's feedback score on eBay?
answer: A seller's feedback score is displayed as a percentage beneath their username on their listings.

question: What does a feedback score of 99.5% indicate?
answer: It means that 99.5% of the buyers who left feedback for the seller had a positive experience.

question: What are detailed seller ratings and what do they include?
answer: Detailed seller ratings provide a breakdown of how buyers have rated a seller in areas such as item description, communication, shipping time, and shipping and handling charges.

question: What is the time frame for leaving feedback for a seller after receiving an item?
answer: You have up to 60 days from the date you received your item or from the expected delivery date to leave your ratings and feedback for the seller. If no expected delivery date is provided, you have up to 90 days from when you completed your purchase.

question: What benefits do Top Rated Plus listings offer to buyers?
answer: Top Rated Plus listings offer buyers a free 30-day or longer return window and same- or 1-business day shipping with tracking provided.

question: What is considered seller fraud on eBay?
answer: Seller fraud is any attempt by sellers to misrepresent themselves, or the products they're selling.

question: What are some warning signs of seller fraud?
answer: Warning signs of seller fraud include short duration listings, heavily discounted or sold-out items, off-eBay contact or payment requests, unsafe payment methods, and listings from accounts that were previously only used for buying.

question: Why should I be cautious of short duration listings?
answer: Fraudulent sellers often want to close a deal quickly, so they may use one-day listings to reduce their chances of being caught.

question: How can I report a suspected fraudulent seller?
answer: If you think you're dealing with a fraudulent seller, report it to eBay as soon as possible.

question: What payment methods should I avoid to prevent fraud?
answer: You should avoid payment methods that are not included in eBay's Accepted payments policy, such as wire transfers to overseas accounts, prepaid cards, or cryptocurrency, as these payments can't be traced or recovered if there's a problem.

question: What should I do if my item hasn't arrived?
answer: If your item hasn’t arrived, take a look at our article on returns, items not received, and refunds.

question: How can I resolve an issue with a seller?
answer: Talking with the seller is usually a good way to resolve any issues you might have with your order.

question: What should I do if a seller asks me to revise my feedback?
answer: You can find out how to respond if a seller asks you to revise your feedback in our articles.

question: What steps can I take if I suspect a seller is violating policies?
answer: If you think that a seller is violating one of our policies, you can let us know and we’ll look into it.

question: How can I report seller fraud?
answer: You can learn about the warning signs of seller fraud and how to let us know if you’ve spotted something suspicious.

question: What are buyer requirements and how can they help me as a seller?
answer: Buyer requirements allow you to block buyers from bidding on or purchasing your items based on specific criteria, helping you manage who can buy from you.

question: How can I exclude specific shipping locations for my listings?
answer: You can set exclusion lists for both domestic regions and international countries/regions, preventing buyers from checking out with shipping addresses in those locations.

question: Can I allow certain buyers to bypass my buyer requirements?
answer: Yes, you can add specific buyers to your Buyer requirements exemption list to exempt them from your requirements.

question: What happens if a buyer is blocked by my requirements?
answer: Blocked buyers are still able to contact you about your listings by default, unless you select the option to not allow them to contact you.

question: How do I view the activity log for my buyer requirements?
answer: You can view your Buyer requirements activity log, which includes information on who you blocked, the date they were blocked, and the reason for their blockage.

question: What is the Buy It Now option on eBay?
answer: Buy It Now is the simplest way to price an item on eBay; it lets your buyers make a purchase right away.

question: How can I set a Buy It Now price for my listing?
answer: To set your Buy It Now price using the quick listing form, enter it in the Choose a format and price section. If you use the advanced listing tool, you can enter the price in the Pricing section.

question: Can I change the Buy It Now price after my item is listed?
answer: Yes, you can lower the Buy It Now price for fixed-price Buy It Now listings and for auction listings with no more than 12 hours left and no bids.

question: What happens to the Buy It Now option when someone bids on my auction listing?
answer: When someone bids, the Buy It Now option usually disappears; however, in the case of reserve price listings, the Buy It Now option remains until the reserve price is met.

question: How can I offer personalization for my item when using Buy It Now?
answer: When you create your listing, go to Optional item features and select Personalize. You can provide information in a free form text field for your customers to tell them what you need in order to personalize the item.

question: What payment methods are automatically added when I create a listing on eBay?
answer: When you create a listing, eBay will automatically add credit card, debit card, Apple Pay, Google Pay, and PayPal as payment options at checkout.

question: Will American Express be accepted as a payment method on eBay after August 17, 2024?
answer: No, American Express will no longer be accepted as a form of payment for checkout or selling fees on eBay beginning on August 17, 2024.

question: Can I accept additional payment methods when selling on eBay?
answer: Yes, depending on the category and the country you’re selling in, you may choose to accept additional payment methods such as checks, money orders, cash on pickup, and wire transfer.

question: What should I do if I want to accept checks or money orders?
answer: You can accept checks or money orders by selecting these payment options in the Payment options section when creating your listing. Make sure your address is up to date if you’re accepting payments through the mail.

question: What protections does eBay offer for transactions completed with offline payment methods?
answer: eBay's seller protections, including the eBay Money Back Guarantee, do not cover offline payment methods completed outside of eBay, such as cash, checks, bank-to-bank transfers, or money orders.

question: What tools are available to help me manage my listings?
answer: We have a range of tools and options to help you create and manage your listings effectively while increasing your sales.

question: How can I find out about the zero insertion fee listings I receive each month?
answer: Discover how many zero insertion fee listings you receive each month.

question: What should I consider when choosing the item condition for my listing?
answer: On the listing form, the item condition options can vary depending on the category that you list in. Find out how to choose the best one for your item.

question: What are promoted listings and how can they help my sales?
answer: Promoted listings are ads that eBay Store subscribers can purchase to give their listings more exposure on eBay.

question: How can I improve the placement of my listings in Best Match searches?
answer: Get tips for achieving higher placement when a buyer uses a Best Match search.

question: What happens when an eBay auction ends?
answer: When the auction ends, you sell to the highest bidder.

question: How long can I set my auction to run?
answer: You can choose whether your auction should run for 1, 3, 5, 7, or 10 days.

question: What is the benefit of setting a low starting price for my auction?
answer: A low starting price can help attract bidders.

question: Are there any fees associated with listing items in an auction?
answer: You may be charged an insertion fee to list your item, and you’ll be charged a final value fee after the sale.

question: Can I add a Buy It Now price to my auction listing?
answer: Yes, you can add a Buy It Now price to an auction listing, and it will be shown until the first bid is placed, but it must be at least 30% higher than the auction starting price.

question: What tools can I use to manage bulk listings on eBay?
answer: You can use Seller Hub Reports, Merchant Integration Platform, Inventory API, Trading API, Sell Feed API, and the Bulk Listing Tool to manage bulk listings on eBay.

question: What is the maximum feed file size supported by the Merchant Integration Platform?
answer: The maximum feed file size supported by the Merchant Integration Platform is 25 MB.

question: How many listings can I manage at once using the Bulk Listing Tool?
answer: You can manage up to 2,000 listings at once using the Bulk Listing Tool.

question: What functionalities does the Bulk Listing Tool offer?
answer: The Bulk Listing Tool allows you to relist items, revise existing listings, sell similar products, and finish multiple drafts.

question: What is the complexity level of using Seller Hub Reports?
answer: The tool complexity of using Seller Hub Reports is medium.

question: What is a Second Chance Offer?
answer: A Second Chance Offer gives non-winning bidders the opportunity to buy the item at a price equal to their last bid.

question: When can I make a Second Chance Offer?
answer: You can make Second Chance Offers up to 60 days after an auction ends.

question: What are the conditions under which I can use Second Chance Offers?
answer: You can use Second Chance Offers when the winning bidder didn’t pay and you canceled the order, when your reserve price wasn’t met, or when you have more of the same item available for sale.

question: How do I make a Second Chance Offer?
answer: To make a Second Chance Offer, find your listing in My eBay Selling Activity or Seller Hub, select Second Chance Offer from More actions, choose the quantity, duration, and bidders, and then continue.

question: What happens if the bidder does not respond to my Second Chance Offer?
answer: Your offer expires if the bidder doesn’t respond within the duration you chose.

question: How do I set up my eBay account?
answer: You can set up an eBay account using your email address or one of your social accounts.

question: What should I do if I have trouble accessing my eBay account?
answer: Learn how to sign in and sign out of your account and what to do if you have any problems accessing your eBay account.

question: How can I customize my eBay account settings?
answer: You can customize your account by changing your account settings, including your preferences, contact information, and subscriptions.

question: What steps should I take if I think my eBay account is compromised?
answer: Learn how to protect your eBay account from hacking and fraud, and if you think your account is compromised, eBay will work with you to secure it.

question: What do I need to know about starting a seller account on eBay?
answer: Read the overview on getting started with your seller account to learn how to start selling your items on eBay.

question: How do I sign in to my eBay account?
answer: To sign in, go to the Sign in page, enter your email address or username, select Continue, enter your password, and then select Sign in.

question: What should I do if I can't remember my password?
answer: If you can't remember your password, you can reset your password by following the reset link on the sign-in page.

question: Can I sign in to eBay using my social media accounts?
answer: Yes, you can sign in using Facebook, Google, or Apple if you've linked your accounts.

question: What are passkeys and how do I set them up for my eBay account?
answer: Passkeys allow you to sign into your eBay account using a fingerprint, pattern, or PIN without entering your password. You can set them up from the Sign in and Security settings in your eBay account.

question: What should I check if I'm having trouble signing in?
answer: Make sure Caps Lock isn't on, look for spelling errors, and if you've recently changed your username or password, try entering the new information manually.

question: What tools does eBay offer to help me manage my listings?
answer: eBay offers various tools such as Seller Hub, Selling Manager, Selling Manager Pro, and Discounts Manager to help you create, manage, and promote your listings.

question: Are there any costs associated with eBay's selling tools?
answer: Some selling tools are free to use, while others are subscription-based.

question: How can I start selling on eBay?
answer: If you're just getting started with selling, you can find helpful information in the 'Start selling on eBay' section.

question: What is Discounts Manager and how can it help me?
answer: Discounts Manager is a tool for Store subscribers that helps you plan and carry out discounts to attract buyers.

question: Can I manage my eBay listings using a mobile device?
answer: Yes, you can use the eBay app to create and edit listings on the go.

question: What should I do if I've forgotten my eBay password?
answer: If you've forgotten your password, select the 'Reset your password' button and follow the instructions to verify yourself by email or text.

question: How can I change my eBay password for security reasons?
answer: If you know your current password, select the 'Change your password' button or go to the Account section of My eBay, then select 'Sign in and security', click 'Edit' next to Password, enter your current and new password, and select 'Submit'.

question: What should I do if I suspect my eBay account has been hacked?
answer: If you suspect your account may have been hacked, go to the article on getting help with a hacked account.

question: What troubleshooting steps can I take if I'm having problems changing my password?
answer: Make sure Caps Lock is off, clear your cache and cookies, and check that your browser isn't auto-filling the password field with an old password. If you've tried to change your password more than 5 times in the last 24 hours, you need to wait 24 hours before trying again.

question: How can I ensure my eBay account remains secure?
answer: It's recommended to regularly update your password and you will receive an email if a new device or browser is used to sign in to your account that hasn't been used before.

question: How can I change my eBay username?
answer: You can change your username in the personal information section of My eBay or by selecting the button provided.

question: How often can I change my username on eBay?
answer: You can only change your username once every 30 days.

question: What should I consider before changing my username?
answer: Think carefully before you change your username, as other buyers and sellers may not be able to find you as easily, and your username represents your reputation on eBay.

question: What happens to my feedback score after I change my username?
answer: Your feedback score will be transferred to your new username, and your new username will automatically replace your old username wherever it appears on eBay.

question: Can someone else use my old username after I change it?
answer: No, your old username can’t be used by anyone else on eBay for 30 days after you change it.

question: What should I do if my account is restricted or suspended?
answer: If your account is restricted or suspended, we'll send an email to your registered email address and to your eBay messages explaining why and what you need to do for reinstatement.

question: Why might my account be restricted or suspended?
answer: Your account may be restricted or suspended for several reasons, including unpaid eBay selling costs, needing to reimburse eBay for a refund, unresolved buyer issues, policy violations, inability to verify your account information, or suspicion of third-party access.

question: How can I reinstate my account if it was suspended due to unpaid selling costs?
answer: To reinstate your account, you can make a one-time payment to resolve the issue. Once eBay receives your payment, your account will be reinstated.

question: What actions am I unable to perform while my account is restricted or suspended?
answer: While your account is restricted or suspended, you may not be able to bid, buy, sell, leave feedback, create or revise listings, contact bidders, reply to eBay messages, or update your personal information.

question: How can I tell if an email about account restrictions is genuine?
answer: To confirm if an email about account restrictions is from eBay, check your Messages. If you can't find a copy of the email there, then it wasn't from eBay.

question: What can I do with Seller Hub Reports?
answer: With Seller Hub Reports, you can create listings in bulk, upload, download, and schedule reports, fulfill orders, mark items as dispatched, find items that have been paid or posted, manage feedback, and identify and fix errors in your listings in bulk.

question: How do I get started with Seller Hub Reports?
answer: To get started with Seller Hub Reports, you need an eBay account with access to Seller Hub. Business sellers are automatically opted in, while private sellers need to have made at least one sale to gain access.

question: What is the process for uploading templates in Seller Hub Reports?
answer: To upload templates, go to the Upload section of the Reports tab, select the Upload template button, choose the appropriate file type (.xlsx or .csv), select the template type you're uploading, and then click Upload.

question: Can I schedule reports in Seller Hub Reports?
answer: Yes, you can schedule reports in Seller Hub Reports. You can choose the frequency of your reports (Hourly, Daily, Weekly, or Monthly) and set a run time.

question: What is the Merchant Integration Platform?
answer: The Merchant Integration Platform is a bulk management tool for high-volume sellers that allows them to upload a CSV or XML file to list products, manage eBay inventory, and fulfill orders. It is especially useful for sellers with SKU-based inventory.

question: What do I need to create an eBay account?
answer: To create an eBay account, all you need is an email address.

question: How can I create an eBay account using my Facebook account?
answer: To create an eBay account using Facebook, go to the Registration page, select 'Continue with Facebook', sign in to your Facebook account, allow eBay to access your public profile and email address, confirm the email address for your eBay account, and then select 'Create account'.

question: Can I register as a business seller on eBay?
answer: Yes, if you're thinking about selling on eBay, you can choose to register as an individual or a business seller by selecting 'Create a business account' on the registration page.

question: What should I do if I want to upgrade from a personal account to a business account?
answer: To upgrade from a personal account to a business account, go to Account settings in My eBay, select Personal information, edit your Account type, confirm the upgrade, specify your business operation type, and enter your business information.

question: Is it possible to have more than one eBay account?
answer: Yes, you can open more than one eBay account as long as you use different email addresses and usernames for each additional account.

question: Why would I need to send an invoice to a buyer?
answer: You may need to send an invoice if the buyer is purchasing several items and you want to combine them, if you need to change transaction details at the buyer's request, or if the buyer hasn't paid for an auction they won.

question: How can I send or revise an invoice through Seller Hub?
answer: In Seller Hub, select Orders, then Awaiting payment. From Actions, select Send invoice, make any necessary changes, and then select Send invoice.

question: What should I do if I want to combine payments for a buyer?
answer: You need to enable combined payments in your account under Shipping Preferences, then select Edit next to Combined Payments, check the box to allow combined payments, and save.

question: What happens if I try to send an invoice more than 30 days after the listing ended?
answer: You can't send an invoice if it has been more than 30 days since the listing ended.

question: Can I add a message to the invoice I send to a buyer?
answer: Yes, you can enter a message to the buyer as an optional part of the invoice.

question: What happens if I close my eBay account?
answer: If you close your eBay account, you’ll no longer be able to sell on the site or access My eBay. You’ll also lose your feedback as well as your purchase and sales history.

question: What should I do before closing my eBay account?
answer: Before closing your account, make sure all your fees and other selling costs are paid, your available funds are at zero, you don't have open bids or pending transactions, and you've canceled all your subscriptions.

question: How long does it take to close an eBay account?
answer: Generally, it takes 14 days to close an account from the date we receive a request, though it may take up to 60 days if you've had any transactions, payments, claims, or disputes in the previous 30 days.

question: Will my personal data be deleted when I close my account?
answer: Yes, once your account is closed, your data will be deleted, and you will be notified by email.

question: Can I reopen my eBay account after requesting to close it?
answer: If you change your mind during the time it takes to close your account, you can contact us and ask to have it reopened, provided your account is in good standing (not restricted or suspended).

question: What should I do if I suspect my account is compromised?
answer: If you suspect your account is compromised, let us know so we can get it back under your control.

question: How can I keep my account safe?
answer: One of the easiest ways to keep your account safe is to regularly change your password.

question: Why is it important to keep my contact details up-to-date?
answer: It is important to make sure your contact details are up-to-date so we can get in touch with you with important information about your account.

question: What can I learn about spoof emails?
answer: You can learn how to recognize and report spoof emails and websites.

question: How can I report unwanted emails or policy violations?
answer: You can learn what type of email you’ll receive from eBay and how to report unwanted email or a policy violation.

question: What are private listings?
answer: Private listings allow buyers to remain anonymous when they bid on or buy an item, with usernames hidden from other members viewing the listing.

question: Why would a seller choose to create a private listing?
answer: A seller might choose to set up private listings when selling high-priced items or pharmaceutical products to keep buyers' purchases confidential.

question: How can I create a private listing?
answer: You can create private listings using the advanced listing tool by selecting 'Edit all options' from the Pricing section, then selecting the settings icon at the top of the Pricing popup, and setting 'Private listing' to on.

question: Can other users see who bought an item from a private listing?
answer: Unless you’ve set your listing to private, anyone can see which user bought the item after the listing ends.

question: What types of items are recommended for private listings?
answer: Private listings are recommended for high-value items or health-related products, as buyers may want to keep such purchases confidential.

question: How long does it take for my listing to appear in eBay searches?
answer: Your item should appear in eBay searches within 24 hours after you create a listing.

question: What should I do if I can't find my listing after 24 hours?
answer: Check the Selling section to see whether your listing is active, in draft, or has any other status. The listing needs to be active to be pulled into search results.

question: What are some common reasons my listing might be removed from eBay?
answer: Common reasons for removal include listing prohibited or restricted items, using material that infringes on others' rights, or having a duplicate listing.

question: Can I search for my listing using keywords?
answer: Yes, you can search using keywords in your listing and apply filters to narrow your results.

question: What should I check in my listing if it doesn't appear in searches?
answer: Make sure there are no misspellings, typos, special characters, or that the item is not from a prohibited category. Also, check for duplicate listings.

question: What are zero insertion fee listings?
answer: Zero insertion fee listings allow you to list items for sale in many categories without paying insertion fees, though other fees may still apply.

question: How many zero insertion fee listings do I get with a Basic Store package?
answer: With a Basic Store package, you can receive up to 1,000 fixed price listings, up to 250 auction-style listings in specific categories, and an additional 10,000 fixed pricing listings in select categories.

question: Do I still pay fees if I use my zero insertion fee listings?
answer: Yes, you will still need to pay a final value fee when your item sells, and you may incur fees for optional listing upgrades and supplemental services.

question: Are there any categories that do not qualify for zero insertion fee listings?
answer: Yes, categories that do not qualify include Real Estate, certain Motors categories (like Boats and Cars), and specific Business & Industrial categories (like Heavy Equipment and Food Trucks).

question: What happens if I revise a listing that was created under a conditional zero-insertion-fee-listings promotion?
answer: If you revise the listing so that it no longer qualifies under the terms of the promotion, you may be charged an insertion fee even if some of your free allocation remains.

question: What is the general campaign strategy for promoting listings on eBay?
answer: The general campaign strategy increases the visibility and awareness of your listings by providing general access to ad placements, allowing you to reach more buyers. You only pay a percentage of the total sale amount when your item sells through clicks on your ads.

question: How do I determine my ad rate strategy when promoting listings?
answer: You can choose between a Dynamic ad rate, which automatically updates to the daily suggestion, or a Fixed ad rate, which remains consistent once set. If you select a Fixed ad rate, you will need to set the ad rates for the listings in your campaign.

question: What happens if a buyer clicks on my promoted listing but doesn't purchase right away?
answer: If a buyer clicks on your promoted listing and purchases any of your promoted items within 30 days of the click, you will be charged an ad fee.

question: Can I promote listings in bulk using the general campaign strategy?
answer: Yes, you can promote listings in bulk from Seller Hub Active Listings by checking the boxes next to the listings you want to promote, selecting the Sell it faster dropdown, and then enabling the general campaign strategy.

question: Where can I monitor the performance of my promoted listings?
answer: You can monitor the performance of your promoted listings in the Advertising dashboard, where you can view metrics such as impressions, clicks, quantity sold, and sales revenue generated within 30 days of a click on your ads.

question: What is Best Match on eBay?
answer: Best Match is the default order of search results on eBay, designed to show the most relevant listings based on factors important to buyers.

question: How can I improve my Best Match ranking?
answer: You can improve your Best Match ranking by offering competitive prices, creating complete and accurate listings, writing clear titles, using high-quality photos, and maintaining a positive selling history.

question: What should I include in my item listing to optimize for Best Match?
answer: To optimize for Best Match, include a clear title, accurate description, high-quality photos, item specifics, and complete selling terms like shipping costs and return policy.

question: When should I use auction-style format for selling my items?
answer: You should use auction-style format when you're unsure of the item's value and want to sell quickly, or if the item is unique or hard-to-find.

question: What are some tips for taking photos of my item for eBay listings?
answer: Take high-quality photos from different angles, include images of any flaws or scratches, and avoid adding borders or text to your photos.

question: What is a page view on eBay?
answer: A page view is counted when someone views your listing on the eBay website or mobile app.

question: How can I find the page views for my listings?
answer: You can find your listing page views in the Active and Unsold pages in the eBay app, on the listing page itself, on the Review your traffic page in the Seller Hub Performance tab, and in Promoted Listings campaigns in your Advertising dashboard.

question: What factors can cause a decrease in the 30-day view count for fixed price listings?
